content:
Yes, Cray has collaborated with several companies and research institutions outside the United States. Below are some examples:

1. Partnership with Swiss National Supercomputing Centre: In 2014, Cray partnered with Swiss National Supercomputing Centre (CSCS) to deliver a new XC supercomputer. This collaboration aimed to provide researchers with increased computing power and speed.

2. Collaboration with Met Office in the UK: Cray collaborated with the UK’s Met Office to develop new models of weather prediction. This partnership aimed to improve the accuracy of weather forecasting in the UK.

3. Collaboration with Japan’s National Institute of Advanced Industrial Science and Technology: In 2019, Cray partnered with Japan’s National Institute of Advanced Industrial Science and Technology (AIST) to deliver a new supercomputer. This collaboration aimed to support research in areas such as artificial intelligence, disaster prevention, and drug discovery.

4. Collaboration with University of Stuttgart in Germany: Cray collaborated with the University of Stuttgart in Germany to deliver a new supercomputer in 2017. This collaboration aimed to advance research in fields such as materials science and engineering.

These are just a few examples of Cray’s collaborations outside of the United States. The company has worked with many other organizations in Europe, Asia, and elsewhere to develop innovative supercomputing solutions.
